Mitigating_Factors: Prior consistent clemency support by Canadian government
Risk_Nature: Irreversible harm due to death penalty
Targeted_Individual_Status: Canadian citizen sentenced to death abroad
Geographic_Context: United States (location of imprisonment and sentencing)
Jurisdiction: Canadian judicial review of foreign policy action
Legal_Framework: Domestic administrative law, International human rights law
Governing_Law: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, principles of procedural fairness
Legal_Provision: Principles of procedural fairness in administrative decisions
Decision_Outcome: Government's withdrawal of clemency support found unlawful
Outcome: Court ordered reinstatement of prior clemency policy
Sentencing_Issue: Continued imposition of death penalty without diplomatic opposition
Procedural_Issues: Lack of consultation, absence of articulated policy
